nodes.best_post:
A heads up, this post is going to be aimed at being constructive, in hopes that it doesn't get deleted (and hopefully to not cost me a ban).

Alright, I'm going to start by listing the pros and cons of Gear Vendors.

Pros:
Gives PvPers what they DESPERATELY want
Gives players customization (azerite traits are CRUCIAL in PvP)
Allows players to focus on queuing rather than spamming RNG for their ideal setup
Gives us an end goal to our gearing game cycle
Motivates people to queue (conquest gear currently isn't doing the trick)
Gives players an equal opportunity playing field
Cons
Someone might buy a ring instead of a weapon at the start of the season
Completing a gear set *might* demotivate people after they're done
Might make PvErs have to PvP to fill in a gear set
These cons are easy to mitigate.

First one: Make each piece of gear cost the same amount of conquest. Just because in the past the weapons were a high conquest value, doesn't mean it has to stay that way (that was the first piece the new system gave us anyways).

Second one: Give upgrade tokens or something that add 5-10 ilvl per token and cost the same amount of conquest as a gear piece, that way we can still be competitive to PvE item level.

Third one: Add item level scaling like we had in WoD for PvP combat. Now that World PvP is completely separate from PvErs, it seems like the perfect time to reintroduce this.

Where's the drawback? I just don't understand why the WoD system was removed in the first place, but now that gear matters again, it's CRUCIAL for PvPers to get to choose their gear. It doesn't make sense to restore customization... just to make us not really be able to reliably customize... Haste feels SOOOO important for so many classes due to the GCD changes, and when you can't get it, your class can just straight up feel terrible. Then you have azerite traits, which are the equivalent to legendaries in power at this point... and similarly like legendaries, they are locked behind RNG, and easier to get from PvE, which isn't acceptable for rated PvP.

We Need Gear Vendors

Big Problem With PvP Gear In Shadowlands - How The Vendor Works

.
Gear mattering so much really sucks the fun out of the game for me and I’m sure a lot of other people. I’m not even sure how many games I’ve won or lose at an even playing field. When you do fight someone who has full mythic gear double slappers it feels pretty bad. Not only because it feels like an uphill battle but because you can’t obtain similar quality through arena. PvP has always been my go to content and it’s really fun to play alts in. I really hope we see some changes and see the vendors move to a more MoP or WoD style.
The skill cap some might think has reduced over the last few years which I can agree with but it feels awful for gear>skill to matter so much. Would love to carry around a PvP set that’s full epics and that I had earned to play vs others with the same. Please let’s get together and actually get this changed before Shadowlands starts

The beginning of Legion PVP was rough w/ Holinka at the helm, and there were a lot of cry outs for him to be fired, etc. Then it was announced that he had shifted to another project (which we later found out was BFA class design / balancing). Over the next few months, the blanket 20% main stat nerfs and buffs we had become accustomed to changed to targeted 5% nerfs and buffs to specific abilities, and pvp became very balanced. I can’t think of a single class/spec that was total garbage in late Legion PVP. Maybe Holy Priest.
Here we are half a year into BFA, with Holinka back at the helm and a lot of disappointed and angry players, and high ranked big name streamers to boot. I’m not saying Holinka needs to get thrown to the wolves here, but something went really well in the final year-ish of Legion. Blizzard, can you please shuffle things around to allow for this change again?
Thank you,
A concerned player

nodes.best_post:
As I do tons of testing to back engineer what gear is actually BiS in PvP I found out the coding problem with sockets.
The issue with Sockets is the .6 item levels they add is being added ontop of the template instead of added to the gear.
If you didn’t know completely naked a 120 character has a PvP item level of 286 now. That is the base template implemented after other scaling issues so that way you can’t tank your item level down to zero to get massive damage boost.
Now if you equip an 200 ilvl green item your PvP level actually doesn’t change. Since the 200 ilvl green is below your static 286 item level set template.
So in the test below I equipped the Legendary 267 belt from Legion and obviously it didn’t raise my item level past the 286 template. However when I add 1 socket my PvP item level raises up by .6 item levels to 286.6!!! Here is the problem!!! This belts item level in PvP should be 267.6
https://imgur.com/a/nd7Zqwa
In the second picture I added another gem and it adds another .6 item level to total PvP level which is completely incorrect. It should be changing the item you are socketing .6 item levels.
So my 267 belt with 2 sockets jumped my overall PvP item level from 286 to 287.2 instead of changing what it was supposed to which is my 267 belt should now be 268.2.
So now all Blizzard needs to do is to make sure sockets are being applied to the actual item instead of the overall PvP level causing the negative effects of using gems in PvP. Hopefully they fix this bug soon.
I have some more testing to do because this scaling system was made so much more complicated then they need to as I search for what is actually BiS gear and how to Min/Max properly.
#RemoveScaling
#SaveShadowLands

nodes.best_post:
Pasted from MMO Champion:
Much like upgrading your Benthic gear in 8.2, you simply talk to the upgrade vendor and place the PvP item into the UI menu. You will be able to upgrade a piece 5 times, maxing it out at rank 6. Honor gear is item level 158 at rank 1 and finishes at item level 190, which is the equivalent of rank 1 conquest gear.
Rank 1 - 158 Ilvl
Rank 2 - 164 (+6 Ilvl)
Rank 3 - 171 (+7 Ilvl)
Rank 4 - 177 (+6 Ilvl)
Rank 5 - 183 (+6 Ilvl)
Rank 6 - 190 (+7 Ilvl) (Item turns from rare to epic)
Honor Costs
There is a different Honor currency cost depending on the item you wish to upgrade:
Two-Handed Weapon
Rank 2 - 2625 Honor
Rank 3 - 3150 Honor
Rank 4 - 3675 Honor
Rank 5 - 4200 Honor
Rank 6 - 4725 Honor
One-Handed Weapon, Head, Chest, Leg
Rank 2 - 1500 Honor
Rank 3 - 1800 Honor
Rank 4 - 2100 Honor
Rank 5 - 2400 Honor
Rank 6 - 2700 Honor
Shield, Offhand
Rank 2 - 750 Honor
Rank 3 - 900 Honor
Rank 4 - 1050 Honor
Rank 5 - 1200 Honor
Rank 6 - 1350 Honor
Shoulder, Hands, Waist
Rank 2 - 1200 Honor
Rank 3 - 1440 Honor
Rank 4 - 1680 Honor
Rank 5 - 1920 Honor
Rank 6 - 2160 Honor
Neck, Ring, Cloak, Wrist, Trinket
Rank 2 - 900 Honor
Rank 3 - 1080 Honor
Rank 4 - 1260 Honor
Rank 5 - 1440 Honor
Rank 6 - 1620 Honor
This is absurdity.
So, let me do some maths here.
As a havoc demon hunter, if i want to fill every single one of my slots (and we can just ignore the whole problem with many of the slots not even being bis stat-wise), I need 156,750 honor. Note the base cost of the items were pulled from the beta on September 7th, and aren’t included in the list above.
Right now, a battlegroud win on the beta awards 300 honor. Let’s throw in an additional 100 honor for mid-battleground rewards. So, 400 honor per win. We’ll say 100 honor per loss. I think this is generous, but humor me.
Let’s say you have a 50% win loss rate, so we can average the win vs loss values.
This results in a 250 honor per battleground value.
So, take my havoc demon hunter value of 156,700 honor divided by 250 honor per battleground. This yields 627 battlegrounds.
Let’s say a battleground takes an average of 15 minutes.
That’s 9,405 minutes in total
That’s 156.75 hours
That’s approximately 6.5 days
6.5 days to get 190 ilvl gear. That’s either 4 ilvls below lfr, or 3 above it, depending on the boss from which the loot is dropping.
Mythic dungeon gear is 183 ilvl.
I mean, why even introduce pvp vendors for honor gear if the grind is going to be this unreasonable? Hopefully several hot fixes will come in to correct honor rewards from bg’s

nodes.best_post:
If you need help translating the lawyer speak, what this means is that Blizzard will be honoring the wording of the request but not the spirit of the request. They have come up with a system of vendors, where you get currency and spend it at a vendor, that will likely not deliver on the actual reasons that people liked the vendors in the first place.
It’s likely that you wont see every piece available but only an RNG selection each week.
It’s likely that PvE players will still gear more quickly, and PvP players will still find themselves compelled to participate in mythic+, raids, and Torghast if they want to gear at the fastest rate.
It’s likely that resilience, PvP power, etc are NOT coming back.
Blizzard seems to think that any system they invent, as long as it has currency and vendors, will be accepted by players when the truth is that what players have wanted all along is for playing PvP to be the optimal way to make your character stronger in PvP, and for this to happen in a manner that doesn’t involve RNG but rather you can know in advance “ok on X week I will purchase Y piece”.
As long as the system “fits into [Blizzard’s] broader itemization plans” it does not seem likely that Blizzard will deliver on the spirit of this request.
Source for the quote: interview of the game director by some Twitch streamer (it’s available on mmoc front page)

nodes.best_post:
BEGIN_QUOTE 12/10/2017 11:02 AMPosted by Venruki
Hello friends, I am writing this post due to recent concerns regarding PvP gear.

Apologize in advance for the massive use of the terms "PvP gear" and "PvE gear".

The only advantage PvP gear has in PvP or any other aspect of the game is its item level. PvE set bonuses and trinkets are still far superior in both high end raiding and high end mythic dungeons. This makes sense, high end raiding and dungeons should have beneficial gear for their type of game play.

The issue I'm having is now PvE gear is both easier to obtain and higher item level then its PvP counterpart. Gearing has essentially become irrelevant in PvP and has really taken a back seat this expansion. As a result, its feel like participation is down more than ever.

I'll give you a bit of an anecdote: I've been playing the game since vanilla and haven't really dipped my feet in much PvE content since early WOTLK. This expansion with +10/+15 chests rewards from Mythic+, I decided it was worth my time to complete this task weekly. I didn't feel like I was wasting my time and ended up enjoying the content as a way to progress my character. As a result I've come to really enjoy this type of content and now participate in Mythic raiding as well. If there wasn't that initial incentive to try the content and feel good about getting gear, I never would of done it in the first place.

With that in mind I'd like to now compare ways to gear in PvP content vs PvE content. Strictly in terms of item level here's a list from worst to best.

845 From normal dungeons
870 Random battlegrounds
885 Mythic +0
900 Crafting with blood of sargeras
900 Chest from winning a brawl once every two weeks.
910 Reliquished
915 LFR Antorus
925 LFR Argus
930 Normal Antorus
930 Rare drop from being 2400 rated in arena and winning a match.
940 Guaranteed from every mythic +15
940 Weekly PvP cap for being 2000 rated in arena.
940 Normal Argus
945 Heroic Antorus
950 Weekly PvP cap for being 2400 rated in arena.
955 Heroic Argus
960 Mythic Antorus & Weekly chest from m+ 15
970 Mythic Argus

These aren't the only ways of gearing but most.

For a new or casual player it's easy to see why gearing in PvE is not only much more rewarding but also guaranteed.

Do you know how many times I've heard my PvP buddies say "Lets go get our weekly +15 done" compared to my PvE friends saying "Lets go get 2400 rating so we can get our weekly cap done!". Even if you completely disregard the difficulty of achieving that rating in PvP, there's a monumental time difference in the two tasks, they're not even comparable. And yet, the weekly chest is still higher item level.

A reasonable item level to compete at higher end PvP and PvE is around 940.
Anyone aiming for this goal wouldn't waste their time PvP.

Reminder:

940 Guaranteed from every mythic +15 (GUARANTEED FOR COMPLETING, NOT EVEN IN TIME)
940 Weekly PvP cap for being 2000 rated in arena. (ONCE A WEEK)
940 Normal Argus (ONCE A WEEK)
945 Heroic Antorus (10 BOSSES A WEEK)
950 Weekly PvP cap for being 2400 rated in arena. (ONCE A WEEK)
955 Heroic Argus (ONCE A WEEK)
960 Mythic Antorus (10 BOSSES A WEEK) & Weekly chest from m+ 15 (ONCE A WEEK)
970 Mythic Argus (ONCE A WEEK)

Here's my WW monks armory: https://worldofwarcraft.com/en-us/character/tichondrius/venfuki 4

I've played 219 games of arena this season at roughly 2500 MMR & 2400 CR. So far this season I've received 0 upgrades. The only pieces of PvP gear that remain for me are 2 pieces of elite warforged, something most players would never have access to. What's really disheartening is this problem is even worse for casual, low rated and mid tier PvPers.

People should feel incentivized to play all aspects of WoW. Currently PvP gear has taken a massive back seat and as a result participation and interest feels lower than ever.

Am I alone in feeling this way? END_QUOTE. 


*Slow clap*

Yes, thank you for posting this as I have tried to highlight this where ever I can. I am not asking for elite gear for us bottom feeders.

When I started playing...being able to target and obtain an honor set via doing PVP was the pure greatest joy I had playing this game.

Sure, in Legion I have access to gear that is greater than honor set but I didn't do any PVP to obtain it. And frankly hitting two buttons in PVE to obtain argunite isn't interesting game play to be honest.

PVP gearing system needs some serious help for players at the top, bottom and mid range players. For the rated and non rated players and also for returning players coming mid or late into the season.

nodes.best_post:
Let me shine the light on this in a different way, maybe you’ll understand it better of what Garbagedisc wants to say.
Rogues are the least pruned class in the game, period.
Wanna know what Rogue’s toolkit would look like if we’d take the approach of what warlocks lost? (And many others, for that matter)
Okay here we go. First talent row you have to choose between: Evasion, Cloak of Shadows and Crimson Vial
Second talent row: Shadowstep, Sprint, Vanish
Third talent row: Sap, Blind, Kidney
Fourth talent row: Gouge, Cheap Shot, Feint
You see what I’m getting at? This is what actual pruning looks like, and I’m only getting at the tip of the iceberg here.
Sounds way, WAY too extreme and overblown? Well yeah, guess what? This is what happened to many other classes.
Rogues lost nothing of significance, at least compared to almost all the other classes.
And please, I know the examples are not even good in some cases, and that I mix it up between “Rogue” and “Assassination”, but it should still illustrate pretty well at what I’m getting at here.
Over time, some classes definitely lost not only their toolkit, but they also had to trade something in return if they want to have a strength in some way.
Rogue on the other hand only lost the tradeoffs, while never getting their strengths adjusted down in order to re-balance this.
Stealth has no penalty anymore, heck you even move faster.
Altough it really is absolutely necessary that Vanish had to be fixed, and stealth in that regard as well, it’s just unjustified that you can’t even punish a Rogue for catching him out of stealth, because he still has more than enough time to get the opener.
Combo Points are on you, not on the target. Why does Sap still exist as a 8s incap, with no risk whatsoever with its asinine range…? I could go on and on.
Fear was nerfed from 8s to 6s 2 expansions ago, justifiably so. Many DRs were changed. Kidney is still a 6s stun on 20s CD.
Again… I’m really exaggerating here and not every comparison is fair or even. Yet it still goes to show as to why people really roll their eyes when Rogues think they have been pruned on par with other classes.

I’m going to assume this is a serious post.
I think this is actually a good topic to bring up considering all the mental health talk since reckfuls passing.
I used to struggle with this… a lot. I remember when I was 16 I qued into the top team on the ladder and had a full blown panic attack mid game and just fell to the ground gasping for air.
I think there’s a lot of reasons to get anxiety when your playing arena. Performance anxiety being probably the biggest one.
If your getting anxiety during arena your probably getting anxiety in other aspects of your life. This is just a sign that you need to really focus on ur mental hygiene which a lot of gamers neglect. Exercise, eat healthy, get good sleep, take breaks if your playing wow all day, lean on others for support, and don’t be scared to talk to friends family or a professional if your struggling.
I used to not be able to leave the house due to crippling panic attacks. Since then my mental health has always been my #1 priority and I have a completely normal life now. Every once in awhile I’ll get some anxiety or panic feeling but it’s much more controlled.
Anyways good luck my dude and if anyone is struggling and needs someone to talk to btag me youchie#1413

nodes.best_post:
Figured since the game has been stale i’d compile some feedback. Even if it mostly seen as venting or coming from a place of desperation. I like to think i’m still writing this out of dedication in hopes that something changes and that arena’s continue to have a future for me. Since I still view 3v3 as a unique game mode that could have had a place as a standalone game in previous iterations years ago. Much like how the Moba genre hatched from within warcraft 3. Some of the best things come out of accidents.
That being said i’ll post below some compiled feedback on the aspects of BFA that have had the most negative impact on my personal experience.
Defensive focused gameplay where teams having multiple short defensives make gameplay feel like slow annoying paced turn based combat cooldown trading and is reinforced further by:
Voidstone hasn’t been nerfed for healers in PvP and is still good on DPS despite being -50% for non healing specializations. It also is still bugged and refreshes itself even without maledicts triggering that bug. Ironically fixing the bug and re-allowing cancelaura voidstone removed even more counterplay.
The stamina creep from going up 80k HP in one tier at same time that traits were halfed still hasn’t been addressed or compensated elsewhere damage wise with less gimmicky play styles instead of trait stacking for nerfed burst.
Defensive azerite traits are still grossly overtuned since trait stacking was never addressed.
Even more random passive defensive stuff is going to be added in through minor essences / the absorb weapon enchant in 8.2.
A lot of the map pool favors defensive gameplay or druid/monk mobility like tolviron/black rook hold/mugambala/blade’s edge arena. Tiger’s peak still being bugged/not reintroduced for over 2 months now plays a part in this as well since it was one of the 3 fan favorite most balanced maps (alongside nagrand/ashamanes).
Poor balancing compounds this defensively focused gameplay since:
The previous trait nerf/mana nerfs were lazy and imbalanced. Some of the most obvious factors being how easy it is for rdruids to drink or how much the game is played entirely around DPS selfhealing.
The PvE gear that has been nerfed like prism/trident/plate gloves are still BiS, because there’s slim to none trade off for wearing them.
The only decent PvP trinket is maledict (which fails as a band-aid for pacing). Also there’s no set bonus for wearing 2 pvp trinkets to encourage not wearing better PvE trinkets (ironically PvP on use stat trinkets are good in PvE, but can’t overpower the infinite amount of scripted defensives that are rotated in PvP).
We’ve got next to no class changes despite mountains of feedback from almost every tournament player on twitter and months of the same meta. *Besides the sub rogue changes that spiced things up for a couple of days even though assassination is still better.
Lots of classes have still been left in the dirt like disc priests or feral druids being worse than resto druids with feral affinity. Others have been broken for multiple expansions now like DH mana burn (despite it getting small nerf) or tank specializations that still breed non-interactive and uninteresting gameplay.
The gearing system is completely flawed:
They still haven’t addressed 10 quartermaster coins being a sigil instead of a trophy like they said in a interview.
Gladiator sigils not putting azerite at max level makes getting bad Box RNG on trophies extremely frustrating for using on BiS azerite from conquest rewards.
There’s no system of a pvp equivalent for residium.
Gems bring some customization, but ultimately can be frustrating for gearing when you RNG a gem on a piece with useless secondary stats or when someone else with good RNG has an advantage for having gems on every piece of gear.
There’s no way to target specific secondary stats since there isn’t even a watered down vendor yet. Even a combatant for gold/marks of honor to pick your secondaries properly and use sigils/trophies on would be a massive improvement.
Even if there was a vendor like that and you were guarenteed a sigil every week in your box and glad sigil was on par with warlords trophy farming m+ would still be needed for BiS secondaries since a lot of stat combinations aren’t available on PvP gear. Especially since secondaries on PvP gear have been changing between seasons (s1 dagger having haste crit? vs s2 mastery crit, no mastery vers ring in s2, no caster offhand in loot table etc). A good example of this would be my main character’s armory https://worldofwarcraft.com/en-us/character/us/tichondrius/nahj 15 where excluding azerite/trinkets/weapons I’m wearing only 1 piece of pvp gear despite having higher item level pvp pieces because I want to stack mastery/versatility. Reforging would help this problem.
The tournament realm is hard to emulate practice for Pro’s without giving practice to other teams and hard for people to learn from watching events since it’s drastically different than the ladder based game. Due to player’s properly having their secondary stats and no PvE trinkets / crucible gear which ladder should learn from.
I wish I got into beta to distract myself till the content drought ends, but I didn’t even get into the stress test. Hopefully classic does well enough to bring a wrath server to function as a timeless smash melee for the arena community. Even though late MoP was probably my favorite expansion for class design.
It’s optimistic to hope for, but hopefully some inspiration comes out of legacy class design influencing future retail expansions. Especially in regards to things like unpruned specializations that feel like different improved versions of the same class rather than entirely different classes that are missing 1/3rd of the toolkits.
I just want to continue playing the game I’ve been passionate about for 10+ years for as long as I can. I’m still too addicted to quit, but even if I did i’ll always have some nostalgia over the past. However, I really hope to once again make new memories to think fondly about.

nodes.best_post:
If you won’t take the players word for it, how about Blizzard’s own?
BEGIN_QUOTE I’ve Got the Power!
In Mists of Pandaria, we added PvP Power as a stat that would allow PvP gear to be functionally superior to Raid and Dungeon gear in PvP combat, without exceeding the value of its equivalent PvE gear in PvE content. That was largely a success within instanced PvP Arenas and Battlegrounds, but we think we can do better while also ensuring outdoor world PvP is able to benefit from that same intent. So, in Warlords of Draenor, we’re taking a different approach.
PvP gear in Warlords will no longer have PvP-specific stats. Instead, it will scale up to a higher item level as soon as you enter a designated PvP area, such as an Arena or Battleground, or as soon as you enter PvP combat anywhere else in the world. If you’re out questing with PvP gear, the item’s base item level will be used while fighting back the Iron Horde, but the second that raiding druid tries to gank you, your higher PvP item level kicks in and you’ll have the upper-hand. Each piece of PvP gear will have its PvP item level displayed clearly on its tooltip, so there’s no guesswork involved.
On top of that, all gear—even gear found in PvE content—will be scaled up to a certain minimum item level in any designated PvP area. That minimum is still lower than any of the actual PvP gear, but a fresh level 100 character who’s just wearing some dungeon gear, or even whatever they picked up while questing, will not be at quite as severe a disadvantage should they choose to step into a Skirmish or Random Battleground.
One added advantage of this new system is that most PvE gear will no longer need to be downscaled in PvP areas, as the equivalent PvP gear is already a higher item level in PvP situations. Instead of making players wearing PvE gear feel weaker in PvP, we make players wearing PvP gear feel stronger. The only exception is Mythic raid gear. Mythic’s PvE item level and Conquest’s PvP item level are very close, so we’ll be downscaling Mythic gear slightly in designated PvP areas just to make sure that Conquest gear remains the best available for PvP. END_QUOTE. 
https://blue.mmo-champion.com/topic/310640-warlords-of-draenor-equipping-for-battle/ 1
Please do the right thing, bring back this amazing system for PVP gear, that would be even better with WarMode now implemented.

nodes.best_post:
Hey all,
Gamer dad here and sub’d since November 2004.
As everyone knows (and is probably sick of hearing about) “Classic” is due to be released end of summer and there’s been a ton of hype etc…
This being the Arena forums it comes as no surprise my beloved Arena d00ds have not rolled out the welcome mat and it seems most have no interest.
Many of you seem almost angry or defiant about Classic and secretly (or not so secretly) hope it fails miserably.
For many of us old folk we are excited as all h3ll.
WHY?
I can tell you it’s not really “nostalgia”.
I know that word is thrown around every 5 seconds and there is some truth in those special feels we get when we think about those epic moments we had back in the day.
Those cannot really be recaptured and there is definitely no staying power in a version of wow that is solely predicated on nostalgic notions.
So why are so many people excited to play old content again?
If you didn’t play back then it is very hard to express, but it mostly boils down to community and your sense of place within your community.
Being a part of a server and knowing literally everyone on it.
Being a part of a guild that would bail your a$$ out when being camped and starting a faction war in the middle of a questing hub in Strangle Thorn Vale that might last for hours.
Being a part of a faction and feeling like it mattered.
Knowing the horde who were gankers.
Knowing the horde who were skilled players.
Knowing which Horde guilds were KoS because they had built a reputation for griefing the alliance. etc…
Back then, a player’s reputation preceded them. If you were a good player, be it dragonslaying or pvp - people knew who you were and respect was there.
I didn’t have to look up someones Raiderio or armory them to see if they were “good”.
I likely leveled with them.
Probably fought horde alongside them in world pvp.
Helped them fend off Horde during World Boss kills.
The list goes on and on.
Basically, built camaraderie with my fellow neckbeards.
Bringing back classic isn’t about downing Ragnaros for the billionth time.
It’s about being a part of a gaming community that feels as real as a gaming community can feel.
Oh and some food for thought before i leave!
Even if you despise the idea of classic servers understand how much it can help “live” gameplay.
A lot of the mechanisms we miss that dramatically impact pvp/arena were present in Vanilla. And the success of Classic will surely lead to positive changes that even “live-only” players will love.
And just think, if Classic goes well they have all but stated TBC would be next.
If that is indeed true i will never touch live again because TBC arena was incredible for so many reasons.
Anywho, just my .02 copper on the subject.
Cheers!
Uncle Trafficz

nodes.best_post:
The current state of arena just might be the worst I can ever remember it being. I never have a queue session and have any fun at all, just frustration and a headache after every queue session.
EVERY single game has a MW for a healer, in 2s and 3s. It’s almost as if other healing specs simply don’t exist anymore. If you do manage to find a unicorn that is any other healer, the game is drastically easier than even the really bad MW rerollers.
The recent nerfs to DKs/Eles didn’t seem to do anything at all, especially in the case of DKs. I find it amusing that the only issue they had pre-8.1 was their survivability, so for some reason Blizzard gave them one of the most OP pvp dps cds ever in this game, Raise Abomination. It’s even MORE amusing that I haven’t seen a single DK even running the new Lichborne talent to help their survivability, since death strike got so massively buffed.
We need hotfixes SOON, like in the next few days “soon”. I can’t imagine going another month with this awful meta. Here are some changes off of the top of my head that might make things better:
Mistweavers: Whether it will take multiple nerfs or just one big nerf, it’s hard to say. It’s hard to decide which is more broken: the short cd on cocoon, the ridiculous damage/healing of crane, or how they can top someone off in seconds even with no cooldowns up. Perhaps a flat % healing nerf overall is needed. Their mobility would be okay if their healing/damage output wasn’t so broken.
DKs: Raise Abomination either needs a much shorter duration (as in half), or a doubled cooldown, or maybe give it a low health value so you can dispatch it quickly. That 25% nerf didn’t do anything. No pvp talent should be that strong. Death strike needs a nerf as well. Make it slightly better than pre-8.1, but it’s too strong as-is. The fact that no one even uses Lichborne is testament to this.
It also might be time to get rid of their interrupt from their empowered ghoul. Having 4 stops for casts from one spec alone is too much for how the game is now.
Warlocks: The armor increase from demon armor was too much at 275%. Now they feel like pre-8.1 shadow priests, notably destro locks with demon armor. It should go back down to 200% as it was on the PTR. Warlocks should not have more armor than plate dps specs.
Ele Shamans: Their damage is still pretty stupid, but I think the lightning lasso hotfix was good, even though it’s still a pretty dumb ability. I think the main problem with them currently is how strong their off-healing is, and I think maybe a 15% nerf or so on healing surge might be warranted.
Shadow Priests: Was giving them greater fade really necessary, with the huge buff they got to dispersion? I don’t think so. Either up the cooldown on greater fade, or make it just a quick immunity (like 1 second) that they can use to skillfully avoid an incoming attack, like how demon hunters used to do in Legion with Blade Dance, before Blizzard broke that interesting mechanic by making it their main priority attack in their rotation.
There are plenty of more stupid things in the game, like the aforementioned current iteration of Blade Dance for DHs, and mages casting with shimmer, but I don’t see those getting fixed at all until the next expansion. The above suggested changes would at least hopefully make the rest of this season tolerable until the next season starts.

nodes.best_post:
Well hey man, few things.
PvP’ers are egotistical, or rather almost all gamers are; especially when referencing their favorite facet of the game. Let me help to explain why.
Someone like yourself who knows their class fairly well, is still going to have almost as hard of a time getting into pvp as someone even more fresh to the scene. This is because the required skills go beyond what you’ve needed to do thus far.
You primarily PvE right? You are like 3/8 mythic, you do 13-14 keys…so sure, you understand your abilities and when to use them against predetermined mechanics. You probably know how to dps without too much overlap to maximize that 1-2% deviance. That’s really where your advantage ends, and it’s not much. By comparison, this is the first expansion in… a decade really that I’ve raided and first time I’ve ever done mythic +. I’m also 3/8 Mythic and I regularly do 12ish keys. I super, super casually do that for the sake of weekly “chores” or just to get my pve chests and such. Doing that content is something I do while I kinda watch tv and just chill or eat. I’m only like a 2.2-2.3ish player on my best days. (Highest 2s mmr was like 2500). Now that’s not meant to be a brag to you or any other pvper, I know better than to brag about such a low rating on these forums, even if it is a personal best. It’s just that being a decent pvp’er trying to do pve chores is much easier than doing decent pve and trying to do pvp content; at least for me and most others that I know. For instance, once you learn a fight, which takes a 5 min YouTube video, then you’re good to go. No surprises, everything is scripted. Raiding, by comparison, is easy. Mythic+ is like trying to do a level of super Mario in a speed run. It’s super easy content. The only hard part is moving incredibly quickly without making mistakes or something. It’s not like…mentally taxing or require any critical thinking. Again, you have a game plan and you just stick to it.
Pvp is just different, and this is where your problems start to arise. You’re going against real people…things dynamically change. You need to outsmart humans. You need to have reactions to every possible thing someone can do. Now of course certain scenarios can be scripted. Some things warrant a certain response; there’s always a preferred reaction to things, but it doesn’t have to be. It’s up to the opponents’ strategy; something a pve’er has never dealt with. You can always have a wrench thrown in your plans.
So, to get to the long drawn out point, I’d argue that pvp is hard. You can say it’s not and call it convoluted but you and I both know that’s basically the same thing. It’s “difficult to get into or understand”… aka hard. It’s not hard to learn all the classes, that’s just memorizing. I get that. And it’s a LOT of memorizing. But it is hard to react appropriately to every single scenario from every comp playing as every comp; and not react like you’re taking a written test, react like within a second. It is hard to track drs and cds for your team and the enemy while analyzing what that means all the while playing. It is hard to position properly which is almost its own mini game within the mini game that is arena. There’s so much to do it can be overbearing. You have to think multiple steps in advance. Like chess. But you don’t take turns like a board game. You move as quickly as you can.
So respectfully, you’re just not mechanically there. You’re not mentally there either. You can’t be because you’ve never done these mechanics, and that’s okay. In order to get there, you have to respect the content and what you’re trying to do. It IS hard and you can’t tell yourself it’s not because you can do a 14 key. Of course that bleeds into people telling you “it’s easy, it’s easier than it’s ever been, it’s dumbed down” etc. This is just ego and/or familiarity. These are people who have been doing it for many years, like you said. It may be easier than it was but it will still always be more difficult than the other content. Human opponents are always harder than computers at top level, especially when these computers don’t even utilize AI really. And I understand these people demand a certain level of experience before even giving you time of day which can be frustrating for someone new. They do this because they don’t want to accompany someone else on their journey of learning, because they know just how long and arduous that can be.
So yeah you’re right on how others make it difficult to get into. But perhaps if you had a different mentality going in, as something that is new and challenging instead of just tedious and annoying, you’d have different results. Don’t blame the fact that you need to play a certain meta to succeed, because you don’t. There’s far more classes you can play than those you “can’t” and honestly you can play whatever you want up to 2k rating by most people’s standards. Learning the game is far more important than playing a fotm. If you think there’s too much cc, that’s just because it stops you from pve’ing which is your comfort zone. Either embrace pvp and truly try to learn, or don’t bother because it’ll only frustrate you.

Currently there are 4262 people above gladiator cutoff in EU.
Some simple math for those who do not know right away is below!
Old Gladiator title was top 0.5%, so if we were to say that 4262 people were the top 0.5% of the current population on EU that would mean the following
4262 x 2 = 1% = 8,524.
Multiply by 100 = 852,400 active arena participants would be required in the old system in order for that many people to receive the Gladiator title.
There were less than 100,000 in half of the Legion seasons.
In fact if you take a season which had 100,000 participants and said “Oh, 4300 of them get glad.”
That would be 4.3% of the participants, or 4.3% of the active ladder
Duelist is top 1-3%
SOME MORE MATH
BFA Legion Season 4
(Top 0.5% of each faction)
308 Horde Gladiators = 61,600 total players
198 Alliance Gladiators = 39,600 total players
61,600 + 39,600 = 101,200 active players.
Current # of glads in EU = 4262
Gladiator on EU would be top 4.21% of the ladder on NA in Legion S4.
